content:
I don't know what link you're referring to, but these steps work, assuming Windows:

BACKUP

  1. ensure thunderbird is not running
  2. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  3. this should open windows file explorer in Appdata\roaming folder
  4. highlight the Thunderbird folder and copy to external media

RESTORE

  1. ensure thunderbird is installed and NOT running
  2. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  3. you should be in Appdata\roaming folder , copy&paste the exported Thunderbird folder there. This will prompt to overwrite an existing folder of same name. allow it
  4. start thunderbird and all should be there
creator: davidsk

content: That does not look like a product officially supported by Thunderbird. Do you recall where you got it? All I can state is that using a backup tool other than from Thunderbird has no guarantees, and persons on the support forum will not be able to assist. From my experience, the only backup that works every time is one done using the OS's file management software.

content: I downloaded this from a website some years ago, assuming it was a recommended Mozilla backup product. I backed up my account then, but never had any reason to use it, and now that I have a new computer, it does not seem to work anymore, so I am glad I asked about it and will use the recommended OS.s file management software mentioned. Thanks for the advice.

content: You're welcome. Also, should you have problems in a restore, it's easier to get help because the issue is simpler to address. :)

content: One more thing: Thunderbird DOES have a backup and restore feature. It's at the tools>export menu. But it has proved unreliable and problem-prone and difficult to recover from it.

content:
Here are instructions for applying css:

Help/Troubleshooting Info, Profile Folder, Open Folder, close TB, create a new folder named chrome, create a new document in chrome with a text editor, name it userChrome.css, Save as type: All files *.*, copy in the css code, change the font size or family as desired. Double-click toolkit.legacyUserProfileCustomizations.stylesheets to true in Settings/General/Config. editor, restart TB.

Online css generator

video: How to create a css file (Firefox or TB)

Test the method with a simple css that sets the background colour of the Folder Pane: 

#folderPane { background-color: lightgreen !important;}
creator: sfhowes

content:
This is how I've always done it (Windows). It preserves your whole existing setup.

Copy TB files from the old PC

- launch TB on the old PC

- go to TB menu > Help > Troubleshooting Information

- click the Application Basics > Profile Folder 'Open Folder' button

- the profile folder will open

- navigate three levels up to the AppData\Roaming folder

- close TB

- copy the AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird folder to a flash drive

---

Skip to 'Paste the copied TB files to the new PC', as you already installed TB and created a profile.

Install and launch TB on the new PC, then start setting up the new profile.

- on the 'Set Up Your Existing Email Address' screen, enter name and email address only

- click the 'Configure manually' link

- scroll down and click 'Cancel'

- exit setup

- close TB

---

Paste the copied TB files to the new PC

- open the AppData\Roaming folder like you did above

- delete the Thunderbird folder, or copy it somewhere if you want to save it

- replace it with the Thunderbird folder from the flash drive

- launch TB

Pop over to this page and try it out. https://dkimvalidator.com/

There is no Dmarc, so that will cause Google Yahoo and Outlook delivery issues. See https://mxtoolbox.com/SuperTool.aspx?action=dmarc%3aclaytoncramer.com&run=toolpage

SPF and DKIM are very important in mail delivery these days and cheapest providers generally do not do well in complying.

content:
If you open the Inbox file in Notepad and if you can still see the messages which Thunderbird no longer displays in the thread pane, that means that those messages are marked as deleted with a X-Mozilla-Status: 0009 And as long as you don't compact the Inbox folder those messages cas still be recovered by changing the X-Mozilla-Status: to 0000 or 0001. Actually the easiest way to restore deleted messages is with the add-on "Undelete" https://www.ggbs.de/extensions/Undelete.html

The other question is why those messages disappeared from your Inbox folder. For me this issue looks like an erroneous retention policy. Do you use the same email account on another device or did you change your retention policy (Account Settings > Synchronisation & Storage > Disk Space)? Or R-click on Inbox > Properties > Retention policy ...

Also see this discussion https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1566083

content:
FOR EXISTING FOLDERS These steps may help: To set many *existing* folders, follow these steps: This must be done on an account by account basis.

  1. select table view - the icon just to right of 'quick filter' button above message list pane
  2. select a message folder and apply all desired attributes - View>sort by from menu bar (if not shown, click alt key)
  3. click the icon at right side of column display in message list pane
  4. select the entry near bottom 'Apply current view to...'
  5. highlight 'folder and children'
  6. move mouse left to see account name and move left again to display all account folders. Now CLICK. a small menu will appear to confirm setting all folders within that account.

I did a simple (okay, crude) video at https://davidkirk.org/SettingDefaultFolderView.mp4
creator: davidsk

content:
It would be helpful if you do not create any more questions on this particular topic because you enter some data in each but none have all the same data - basically I'm jumping around trying to find all the relevant data. It means there is loss of continuity. So from now onwards let's keep all conversations in this particular question.

Data I've managed to locate: I'm on Care4free.net and my emails are not coming in (recently resolved outgoing), help

Care4free.net is one of those accounts/email addresses that uses the Plusnet server.

Plusnet says: Important changes to Plusnet webmail, email and domain services We’re moving our services to a new supplier called Greenby.

Good link for information: https://www.plus.net/help/email-account-changes/

Plusnet say: The option to send email without authentication enabled will be withdrawn later this year (2025). That was perhaps a reason why you previously had sending issues

If your email address is with Callnetuk, Care4free, Dialstart, Freenetname, Globalnet, IC24, ICScotland, Madasafish, Totalserve or Totalise then you will need to ensure that the username in your email settings is set as your full email address e.g. username@madasafish.com rather than just username as soon as possible to make sure it continues to work.

You must make sure your username is the full email address.

For Callnetuk, Care4free, Dialstart, Freenetname, Globalnet, IC24, ICScotland, Madasafish, Totalserve or Totalise and Metronet we are enabling the ability for you to use the Plusnet server details to send and receive email using SSL/TLS. You must ensure that the username is configured as your full email address.

Have you received any notification/email saying you are being migrated over to Greenby or migration has occurred? Please note that email may be sent to whatever email was set in the Plusnet Account and it might not be the Care4free.net email address.

Greenby says that providing you have got the correct serdver settings then when migration occurs, you should not need to alter anything.

POP

  • Server name: mail.plus.net
  • Port: 995
  • Connection SEcurity: SSL/TLS
  • Authentication Method: Normal Password
  • Username: full email address
creator: Toad-Hall

content: Can you add a new address? Is there an error when you attempt to edit?
creator: davidsk

content: I can add my son's new email address, but I cannot delete the previously added one, and I cannot edit it. When I type in his name, the system defaults to the now outdated original address. If I recognize this error at the time of the creation of the new email, I can correct the automatically posted but erroneous email address to the current one. But this is awkward and apt to be missed. Many thanks for help. John Clarke
creator: jmcla

content:
See if you can edit another address. If you can, that indicates that his old address is somehow corrupt. That happened to me recently. SO, if that is the case, this works somewhat:

  1. create an export of the addressbook in vcard format (export menu is at the three dots to the right of addressbook name)
  2. open the exported file in Notepad and locate the full info on the bad address - delete all of that, but JUST that. be careful.
  3. create a new addressbook in thunderbird
  4. use the tools>import>import from a file menu to import the vcard export
  5. verify that it's good and then DELETE the original addressbook

There may be better solutions, but this worked for me.
creator: davidsk

content: It has happened to at least 2 email addresses which have been changed by their owners. I accept that I don't know what is going on here, but I will attempt the solution you suggest, for which I am grateful. I may not get to it for a couple of days, but I will report back. Thanks again John
creator: jmcla

content:
1. Open your address books in Thunderbird. (Alt+2)
  2. Right click the address book name in the list of books.
  3. Select properties.

Do you get only a dialog with a name of address book, or one with more details including a read only option?:
creator: MattAuSupport
